details.title: Addendum to: generic rules to evaluate system-failure frequency

authors.affiliation: Relex Software Corp., Greensburg, PA, USA

p: For the biography of Suprasad V. Amari, please see IEEE Transactions on Reliability, vol. 48, Sept. 1999, p 274.

authors.name: S.V. Amari

details.abstract: In the paper on Generic rules to evaluate system-failure frequency, (see ibid., vol.49, p.85-7, 2000) the authora did not consider the case of shorter mission times while presenting the rules to evaluate system-failure frequency. Time-specific failure-frequency calculations are required for the systems with shorter mission times. One of the practical uses of time-specific failure-frequency is in finding reasonably accurate estimates of failure-rate and reliability of large systems consisting of repairable components, by using combinatorial methods (without using Markov models). This paper shows that, with some minor modifications, the rules in the original paper for evaluating steady-state failure-frequency can be used to find the time-specific failure-frequency.

references.title: Generic rules to evaluate system-failure frequency

context.text: If the system is not under steady-state conditions, then the system failure frequency depends on the mission-time of the system; this was not considered in [1].
Therefore, this addendum presents the rules to evaluate time-specific system failure and success frequencies that are similar to the rules in [1].

links.abstract: Frequency of failure of a system with s-independent components can be obtained from the system availability (unavailability) expression and failure and repair rates of the components. Although, Grouped Variable Inversion is an efficient technique to find the system availability, there is no convenient method to convert the "availability expression obtained by this technique" into an "expression for system-failure frequency." This paper present generic rules to find system-failure frequency, part...

references.text: S. V. Amari, "Generic rules to evaluate system-failure frequency", IEEE Trans. Reliability, vol. 49, pp. 85-87, Mar. 2000.

references.title: Rules for calculating the time-specific frequency of system failure

context.text: After some mathematical manipulation, the \$\nu_f\$ expressions in this paper can be converted into the equivalent expressions obtained using [2].

links.abstract: This paper develops formulas for converting expressions for time-specific probabilities of system success and system failure into time-specific frequencies of system success and system failure.

references.text: C. Singh, "Rules for calculating the time-specific frequency of system failure", IEEE Trans. Reliability, vol. R-30, pp. 364-366, Oct. 1981.

nonIeee.title: Assessment of the expected number and frequency of failures of periodically tested systems

ieee.displayText: D. Jacob, S.V. Amari, "Analysis of complex repairable systems", Reliability and Maintainability Symposium 2005. Proceedings. Annual, pp. 183-189, 2005, ISSN 0149-144X.

ieee.displayText: S.V. Amari, J.B. Akers, "Reliability analysis of large fault trees using the Vesely failure rate", Reliability and Maintainability 2004 Annual Symposium - RAMS, pp. 391-396, 2004.

ieee.title: Transformation from availability expression to failure frequency expression
ieee.displayText: M. Hayashi, T. Abe, I. Nakajima, "Transformation from availability expression to failure frequency expression", Reliability IEEE Transactions on, vol. 55, pp. 252-261, 2006, ISSN 0018-9529.
